docs.text: the marvelous british actor derek jacobi stars in writer and director john maybury's love is the devil about the popular modern artist francis bacon .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as always , jacobi's acting is impeccable , but the movie tries hard and succeeds at being unentertaining and opaque .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie convincingly argues that francis , played by jacobi , was a completely despicable and vain individual , but it never provides any insight into his work or any motivation for his attitude .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when interviewed by a fawning talk show host , francis calls his style " chance brushstrokes . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: starting with a burglary of francis's flat , the film uses loud sound effects that sound like they were lifted from a cheap horror movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the camera shots are heavy on the avant-garde angles -- lots of wide-angle close-ups and distorted shots filmed through colored-glass reflections .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the director is much more interested in filmmaking style than in the substance of the story with the result being a sterile examination of a lonely and vain man .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: daniel craig , in a lifeless performance , plays the burglar and boxer , george dyer .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when francis lays eyes on him after the break-in , francis promises not to call the police if he'll stay for sex .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he stays for the entire movie but never respects the man with whom he shares a bed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he thinks that francis's paintings have " no bloody use , " and the movie presents no counterargument .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: writer maybury barely outlines francis's character , and george and the rest of the supporting cast remain a complete enigma .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we learn little of george other than francis's reason for liking him -- george's " amorality and innocence . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: francis's love of sadomasochism is shown early and often .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " boxing is such a marvelous aperitif for sex , " he reflects to george on the way to watch a boxing match .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as the fighter's head is sliced open with a heavy blow , the camera cuts to a gleeful francis whose own head is soaked by the flying blood .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: francis appears to be in complete ecstasy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: another of francis's favorite activities is viewing old movies of atrocities .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as the carnage mounts , we witness an orgasmically happy francis in the audience .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in a film that tries obsessively to shock , one dream sequence portrays a family in a car accident .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: francis's mind slowly examines every bloody limb of the mother , the father , and the boy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sometimes the script throws us tidbits of francis's wisdom which illuminate little while merely sounding insightful .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( " i'm optimistic by nature .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'm optimistic about nothing . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " loneliness is my only true companion . " )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we learn more details about francis's makeup techniques than about the man himself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he prefers shoe polish for his hair and sink cleaning powder for his teeth .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: full of metaphorical interpretations , the film's best scene occurs late one night when george has to get up to go to the bathroom .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mistaking francis's picture of a toilet for the genuine article , he urinates on it and then crawls back into bed contentedly .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: like a parody of a bad art house movie , love is the devil has horrid characters filmed bizarrely and confusingly by a director who is much more interested in technique than storytelling .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: by the end , the audience hasn't learned any more than it could have in a three-minute sketch .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: love is the devil runs 1 : 30 .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film is not rated but should be considered nc-17 for violence , profanity , graphic sex , nudity and sadomasochism and is unacceptable for most teenagers .
docs.label: negative
